intro: Hahnia aria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved hahnia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, delicate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing a pale yellow to greenish color. Hahnia aria microphylla is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
